website_summaries.verdict: While this feeder won't attract butterflies to your garden, it gives kids an opportunity to feed and nurture caterpillars, and set free the new butterflies that emerge.
pros: A kid-friendly kit that includes everything youngsters need to hatch their own butterflies, including 10 caterpillars, roomy pop-up habitat, feeding kit, and instructions
Kids love watching the process, and setting hatched butterflies free
cons: Not all caterpillars will make it to maturity
Shipping in daytime temperatures less than 55°F or greater than 85°F could kill the caterpillars

customer_reviews.title: Amazing to see the transformation up close and personal!
customer_reviews.text: We loved it! We received 12 caterpillars and ended up with 11 butterflies. We watched them and took pictures each day. It was amazing for us to actually see the changes each day. I took the advice of some of the previous reviews and lined the bottom of the habitat with cardboard. The red excretion still got on the sides, but I was able to easily clean it after we released the butterflies. The butterflies were beautiful. Will definitely do this again.
customer_reviews.author: Partyof5

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoyed this kit! The kids looked forward to waking up every morning and seeing how the caterpillars had grown and watching them hatch was really delightful. We received 6 caterpillars in each jar. 1 was unable to remove himself from his chrysalis and another hatched with malformed wings so we will be allowing that one to live out his days here with us. This was a wonderful experience for the children and a great way for them to see the life cycle of butterflies for themselves. We will definitely be purchasing more caterpillars next year because we have decided to make this a summer tradition!
customer_reviews.author: deLUXmomma

customer_reviews.title: Clean the caterpillars poo!! If a cacoon falls, lay on paper towel
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 5yo and 2yo sons. They loved it! I was worried based on some reviews that I wouldnt get many butterflies. But I saw one review that stated they cleaned the Caterpillar poo off of the food so they all were able to get plenty to eat. I think that's what did it! We are waiting on our last butterfly to emerge! So far we have 11 healthy butterflies!
customer_reviews.author: danae

customer_reviews.title: Not able to form chrysalis.
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to get this kit, we have watched the caterpillars grow. We are at the end of day 10 and some are trying to hang in a j but they keep falling. One started a chrysalis but fell and is now dying at the bottom of the cup. I have little hope for the rest. They don’t seem to be able to attach to the top of the cup. We have no touched or bothered them. We have followed all the rules. I will update if any survive.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 4 year old and her sister helped. All you have to do is take the jar out and watch the caterpillars. They do everything. Be a little gentle when you move them to the net and its all a show. We kept them an extra couple of days so they were used to life in net but they eventually left and flew just fine. Plenty of food in the kit for caterpillars and mix for the butterflies. Going to do this again in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Cupp

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived with a note saying that Caterpillars will seem lifeless And to give them a day to come to life. It’s been three days and they are stiff and lifeless. I’m very disappointed, and so if my son. If it wasn’t for coronavirus I’d return.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Uh-oh
customer_reviews.text: My twelve year old granddaughter was so excited to find out this was coming to her (we live a couple of hundred miles apart), so she was watching for it to arrive. She put it all together, read the instructions, followed them carefully--but the caterpillars never moved at all. Very disappointing. I can't easily return the item (social distancing) and neither can she. All we want is for the dead caterpillars to be replaced. I went to the Amazon order but cannot see any place to make this request. Therefore, I'm reaching out through this review. Help!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Gail

customer_reviews.title: Did not include caterpillars or voucher!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my niece for Christmas. We have one of these and my kids have always loved hatching and releasing butterflies. The box arrived today with the warning on the outside: LIVE CATERPILLARS INSIDE but there was no jar of caterpillars and no voucher. I am really disappointed as the description of this product is: Insect Lore Deluxe Butterfly Garden with Live Cup of Caterpillars and Feeding Habitat Kit. I am hoping that calling the company will solve my problem before Dec 25th.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Caterpillars arrived dead
customer_reviews.text: We were very excited for this kit. The kids watched the insect lore butterfly kit video while they waited for the kit to be delivered. The caterpillars have never moved. The website says wait and be patient so that's what we did. Followed the unboxing instructions to the T. 15 days ...no movement. The temperature on delivery day was 73/84. If you do purchase this for children..I would recommend not saying anything to them until you open the box and confirm that you have indeed received healthy caterpillars.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Great, fun, but follow directions to avoid heartache
customer_reviews.text: Follow the directions!!! We mostly did, but when it said to throw away the cup, we felt bad because 2 of our caterpillars had formed their cocoons in the cup, not on the lid, so we didn’t throw it away, just left it to the side. What the directions don’t tell you is that the butterflies will still emerge, but their wings will be so badly deformed that they won’t be able to do anything other than mildly hop and it’s so disheartening. Thankfully my girls were old enough to understand (but still feel bad), and young enough that they didn’t get it. But I’d imagine a child around 5 or 6 wouldn’t react as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dltmom

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this item as an Easter gift for my child. The caterpillars were all alive when we opened the container. My child was able to watch the entire metamorphosis process in real-time. I recommend this product for children aged 3-10. Because of this gift, we now have a butterfly garden outside that my child finds caterpillars on. He finds them and puts the caterpillars into the net enclosure and we watch as more and more butterflies hatch. When choosing which plants to put in the enclosure after the initial caterpillars are gone, I would highly suggest milkweed. Caterpillars love it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, includes live caterpillars
customer_reviews.text: This kit is amazing. It includes the caterpillars (some of the other kits come with a voucher so you would have to pay separate shipping to get them) so you can get started right away. Just make sure someone is home when they’re delivered! I purchased for my 7 year old niece’s birthday and she loves waking up every morning to observe them and make notes in the journal. You can purchase more caterpillars when these hatch, or collect some in the garden. I will be getting one for my kids when they’re a little older.
customer_reviews.author: SDubGold

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable for everyone!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome habitat. Very easy to follow instructions and everything you need to hatch your own butterflies! It came in the mail with 10 caterpillars 5 in each cup. Out of all of those 9 hatched!! Very healthy caterpillars and beautiful butterflies! Just make sure to read instructions and all should hatch properly. You might notice some forming their Cocoon at the bottom or fell off, don’t worry they should be just fine. Just pick them up and gently put them in butterfly habitat when it’s time. Will purchase other habitats that this company makes as well! My kid loved this experience and so did the rest of the family.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: KIDS AND ADULTS ENJOYED
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Gift for my Great-niece’s BD turning 12. She also has a younger Brother, age 8. I live in a different State, and had it sent to them. Arrived on time, everything intact. They have really enjoyed it!! Their parents are very involved in all Activities and they have FaceTimed me with all Stages of Development! All 10 Larvae have made their Cocoons at this time and three have came out. Very Overjoyed watching the process. I have been thanked several times. I definitely recommend this Kit. Photos included. UPDATE: I was sent this Video of the 9th Butterfly emerging! So Cool! It takes about 2 minutes really, so the Video is Sped up 2x.
customer_reviews.author: Sheezawolf

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE One butterfly managed to come out of the cocoon but was not able to wiggle out completely, leaving the wings deformed. This experience has been heartbreaking for my kids and the butterfly that will most likely die. ********************************************* I'm so disappointed with my experience with these caterpillars. Since the caterpillars arrived, one was already dead. The other 4 were moving around and seemed fine. All of a sudden, from one day to the next, they all died. I followed the instructions and they still died. My children were so excited to see the transformation from caterpillar to butterfly. If you're thinking of buying the caterpillars, don't.
customer_reviews.author: MMV

customer_reviews.title: All 10 butterflies survived!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit for my 3 year old granddaughter who is fascinated with insects. All ten butterflies survived although 2 struggled to fly. One tore its wings when coming out of the chrysalis and another had wings bent at the top. The latter emerged from a cocoon that had fallen down. I see on other websites that it is recommended to attach any that have fallen by tape, etc., back into a hanging position. Perhaps this would've helped. We released them into a flowery field with lots of thistle on Mother's Day. It was a memorable experience for all of us. I just ordered another kit for my other set of granddaughters and it arrives today!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my granddaughter, who was delighted, at first. But when they hatched and tried to fly, they got stuck in the "feeders" with the sugar, and died. She cried. There should be some kind of warning in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Everything we wanted
customer_reviews.text: Caterpillars come in closed jars with feeding medium and need to stay in them until they form chrysales. Instructions suggest leaving them alone, which made the experience less optimal since my daughter was looking forward to holding caterpillars. Also, by the end, the sides of the jars are pretty nasty after two weeks of five caterpillars eating and pooping in a small jar. Nevertheless, out of ten caterpillars, ten metamorphosed but only eight emerged healthy, probably better odds than in nature. My daughter loved letting them free and instantly asked for more caterpillars. Overall, I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fun, educational!
customer_reviews.text: Loved watching our catepilars transform! It was so cool watching the get bigger and plumper. I might have enjoyed the process more than my 2 year old. 5 catepilars arrived all alive. One did seem weaker than the others. That one did not become a chrysalis. 4 chrysalis formed and one turned pretty dark, that one didn't survive. We ended up with 3 beautiful butterflie, as promised! So incredibly simple, they arrive in their food. They build some webs and then climb to the top of container lid to hang as chrysalis. You pop the lid off and place it on display holder inside netting. And suprise one day there are butterflies. Will buy again and probably again each year.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa S.

customer_reviews.title: A spirit lifter durring isolation.
customer_reviews.text: This was our family homeschool science project plus a way to brughten spirits durring the pandemic. We loved seeing over the caterpillars today we have one butterfly so far. One caterpillar cocoons a day ahead of the others and he emerged...the others are still cocooned as they wrapped up a day later so maybe tomorrow we'll see them pop out. I recommend putting small terracotta saucers or tiny terracotta pots upside down before they emerge so thet have something to grasp to. Our butterfly today struggled to cling to something so I let him use my finger to get off his back on the slippery floor of the cage. But the terracotta saucers are easy to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Captivating for my Six Year Old Son
customer_reviews.text: Cheers to Insect Lore's Butterfly Garden for their careful preparation and well-thought out product that delivered five beautiful caterpillars for my son to eagerly examine each morning. He has asked a bazillion questions and made notes and drew pictures on the easy to understand activity/log book provided with product. All five caterpillars arrived alive and within four days had tripled in size (no joking!). Our whole family is engaged and we are really looking forward to them turning into butterflies and releasing them into our garden area. Thank you for a great product from a grateful dad! Do you guys sell at-home beer kits too?
customer_reviews.author: Hobbes

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions. Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Ive never done this before and I thought at one point the caterpillars had died hanging upside down because only one turned to chrystalis lol. But I didnt read the instructions completely, and once I did, I realized thats what they do as they change and they change at different paces. The next day, they were all in chrystalis. After another 3 days, I placed them in their habitat. Yesterday we got our first butterfly. Woke up this morning to another one. And not even an hour after that another popped out. My kids are loving it. Very pleased, thus far. Hopefully we get all ten!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: fun at home learning kit
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this kit to a neighborhood child who showed interest in butterflies but the stay at home orders meant no more in person learning at school. This kit arrived quickly with all live caterpillars. The child told me that all but one of the caterpillars survived to crystasllis stage and then all the remaining ones grew to emerge as butterflies. An unexpected result was the lesson about letting things go since she was very sad to set the butterflies free. Overall a great little project at home for younger children, this was perfect for a 7 yr old with some supervision from teenagers in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Em Ru

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent set up. But. They arrived 5 days late, so the caterpillars were already pretty chunky. Didnt get to watch them grow much. 2 butterflies emerged with deformed wings and had to be put out of their misery. A WORD OF CAUTION. If any of your chrysalides fall, dont lay them anywhere near the plastic log in the butterfly habitat! One of ours got stuck to the log as its wings were drying and we had to put that one out of its misery after scraping it off the log with a spoon. Poor experience. Decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Ferrara

customer_reviews.title: Very cool gift for my nephew at his request
customer_reviews.text: My nephew wanted these for his birthday and he loved watching the process of the caterpillars becoming butterflies. There were times that I thought the little buggers were dead, especially in the first few days because they didn't move! Eventually they did and got bigger and fatter almost overnight it seemed. The only part that was a little bit of a let down is the sugar water prep for when they become butterflies, if it spills which it definitely did in our case it will seep right through the bottom and get whatever you have underneath sticky. Great product would definitely gift again.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. P

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! When we first got the caterpillars, only one moved within the first 48 hours and I was worried that they were dead. But then I noticed that there was some webbing around all of them, so I knew they alive. It took our caterpillars the full 10 days to finally turn into a cocoon and now we're patiently waiting for them to pop out as butterfly's. The instructions were well written and very easy to understand and follow. It has been a great learning experience for my kiddos (and myself!). I see more caterpillars and butterfly's in our future.
customer_reviews.author: lisapete

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions to provide proper care!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing experiment to do with young children. Comes with five tiny baby caterpillars. They can only guarantee that three of them will actually turn into butterflies. Please read instructions carefully and make sure to go on Insect Lore’s website to get a better understanding of how to care for them. One of the cocoons had fallen and I didn’t know that I was supposed to pick it up and place it on a paper towel in the net. By the time I learned that from their site, one of the walking caterpillars had eaten the cocoon! Talk about traumatic!
customer_reviews.author: The Outrams

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before really reading the reviews bc I thought it was so cool and my daughter would enjoy watching them. Some of the reviews have said that the lid of the cup has changed and now the caterpillars have trouble attaching to the lid. I found this to be true unfortunately. 1 fell down in chrysalis form already and another is hanging mid air in the webbing. Idk how I will be able to transfer the lid to the habitat without causing that one to fall. If it does fall, it most likely will be deformed as a result if it emerges at all from what I have read. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: The kit comes with everything you need! Such an easy, fun, educational item for children. The cup of caterpillars has food in the bottom so you litterally have to do nothing. There was one caterpillar that was smaller than the others so I was worried he wouldn't make it but all 5 succesfully turned into butterflies! The small one was just 2-3 days behind the others. One of the chrysalis' fell off the lid and still survived. The kit has clear instructions and an awesome educational interactive booklet. I would definitely buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: akc643

customer_reviews.title: Loved the butterflies and it was super simple
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is very into butterflies so we thought we'd try this since we were at home during covid. The pack was pretty simple to set up and watch. It took about 5-7 days for the caterpillars to cocoon, and then 4 of the 5 survived and turned into butterflies. The only awkward part of it all was the food dish. It literally was two packs of sugar. I thought it was going to be something else and made me think I paid a little too much for 5 butterflies, a mesh cage and two packets of sugar. But my girls loved it, I'd get more but probably try to find a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Overprice for 2 Caterpillas
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool and neat idea but for the price that was pay, it was not very good. Overall travel wise its not good for them because of mishandling and bumps on the roads. Once they arrive you have to wait 24-48 hours if they make the journey. They give 6 live caterpillas, so far only 3 may have made it (one of the caterpilla may not form...). Also by the time they came they were already big which is kinda deceiving since it said to watch them hatch and grow. For the price of this product is just disappointing and I definitely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David J

customer_reviews.title: This company is reliable and caring. Meaningful
customer_reviews.text: Such a great idea for so many different reasons. If anyone is going through or is wanting to change the story of butterflies can inspire. I’ve used them for kids teens and adults to symbolize life transitions. Of course spiritual can overlap the science of you choose. My garden always looks happier with butterflies!
customer_reviews.author: Verified Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit for my son for his birthday. It arrived right on time and came with 12 caterpillars instead of 10. While some of them appeared dead upon arrival, none were... (it's important to leave them undisturbed for a day or two to give them time to "wake up" after their long journey.) My daughter set about helping her little brother with the care of his caterpillars and 15 days later we released 12 healthy and beautiful Painted Lady butterflies into the world. Could not be more pleased wit this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: sparrow

customer_reviews.title: So exciting!
customer_reviews.text: We received them today and my kids are so excited! I am too! All 10 caterpillars seem to be doing well, and we can’t wait to watch the process of them becoming butterflies! Update: we had a 100% success rate with our caterpillars! All of them became butterflies and we set them free today! My kids absolutely Loved caring for them. One thing that’s not mentioned in the instructions, that we found on the web, is to spray the chrysalis with water twice a day to prevent dehydration. So we did that. After all, in the wild they do get exposed to rain and dew. It was so much fun! We are ordering more caterpillars! 🐛 🔜🦋
customer_reviews.author: Maria7633

customer_reviews.title: Amazing transformation!!!🐛🦋
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this butterfly kit for a small project to share with students that would be participating in summer school. It would be shown virtually due to the Covid 19. I quickly realized how much I looked forward seeing these insects daily. It was something that my husband and I really enjoyed. I documented most days with a video movie for the students and it turned out great. Most of all though I had never seen this before and I was awestruck by nature and the miracle that these caterpillars to butterflies transformed right before my eyes. I really recommend this for classrooms or as gifts to the insect or nature lover.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Mart

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful experience
customer_reviews.text: We had a great time watching these guys grow up and transform. It was easy and educational. Definitely watch the video about caring for them before you get them. The whole process is kind of gross and messy, but that’s no big deal. Nothing that you’ll have to clean up. Letting them go and having them sit on our hands for a while was the best part. I would suggest that you have fresh flowers to feed them when they emerge from their cocoons. Mine wanted nothing to do with the plastic flower sponge and homemade nectar, but they were very into the daisies offered them.
customer_reviews.author: C0aster14

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend with young children!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this during the Covid quarantine so my daughters could participate in the school activity. What a wonderful memory! I would love to do this again! I only wish the instructions were more descriptive about what to expect along the way. The butterflies will bleed immediately after hatching... wasn’t expecting to have to explain that to a 4&6 y/o. And when I transferred them to the enclosure some of them rapidly twitched which scared me!!! 9 of 10 hatched into butterflies. Even one that cocooned on the ground. I would highly recommend this experience with young children!
customer_reviews.author: P. Clough

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Received item on time. Caterpillars were dead. Have made several attempts to get them replaced Keep getting the run around to wait that they are fine. Sorry but dead is dead. They are not going to come back to life. Children very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Morton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 4 year old since he was learning about butterflies in preschool. This was an amazing experience! I was skeptical at first because I thought it'd be difficult, but it was super easy and fun! We got 10 caterpillars and 9 became butterflies, 2 even started mating (funny for the grownups). When we let them go they unfortunately quickly flew away and did not linger, but our son had fun seeing them off anyway. I highly recommend this experience as it is something truely wonderful to see first hand how a caterpillar turns into a butterfly.
customer_reviews.author: magda

customer_reviews.title: Great life cycle project!!
customer_reviews.text: Our preschool class has enjoyed this butterfly kit more than almost anything else we have done so far this year!! They come in each day in anticipation of what they will find & check in numerous times through the day to see if there has been any change. I don’t think we have lost a single caterpillar out of the 10 that were in the order. The caterpillars have already gotten about 800 times bigger than when they arrived & look like they will be cocooning soon! We ought to have full butterflies just in time for our butterfly theme week!! Thank you so much for this awesome set!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Collins

customer_reviews.title: CUTEST THING!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is so cute! The catepillar's come and are so tiny but grow so quickly! We actually got 6 in our pack not the expected 5 and all lived. My son loved checking on his catepillar's and watching them turn into butterflies. The kit is minimalist and only comes with what you need and not a million extra papers and packaging. The instructions are really simple and taking the cocoons and placing them in the habitat was a breeze. We will definitely be repeat customers. My sons had so much fun with this !
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Berke

customer_reviews.title: We have butterflies
customer_reviews.text: The butterflies were great. The package comes with everything you need. Just follow the directions and you will have up to six beautiful painted lady butterflies. I only lost one butterfly and I think it was because the room was too cold. I had them on the shelf in my classroom. But the others did well and are fluttering around as we speak. Plans to release them tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Curtrina Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great science lesson for kids at home with schools closed
customer_reviews.text: We bought these kits for our grands ages 6, 7, & 8 & they are loving them while learning a Science lesson. With schools closed due to Covid-19 we as grandparents like to help out & encourage our grands to enjoy learning. They are excited with their kits & watching for the cocoons and then butterflies to emerge. Great kit, very well made. My first order with two kits, only one kit arrived, but Amazon quickly sent out a replacement kit. Your kids, grands won't be disappointed in this kit.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Be patient before calling about caterpillars
customer_reviews.text: I was convinced for a few days that most of our caterpillars were dead. However when we realized that they weren't we introduced them to our preschooler and they LOVED this kit. These were our first pets and they were so amazing to observe. This kit is well worth the money and such an exciting learning experience to share in at home during this pandemic. It was so wonderful to let them go and hang out with them for a little bit free in nature. We will definitely be ordering more caterpillars again.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great kit
customer_reviews.text: We received our order sooo later by ups which I am disliking right now if anything happen to these little guys. It states that you get 5 and we got 4 took about 10mins for them to wake up. Everything looks ok ver educational and my granddaughter loves it and hasn’t stop watching there every move. So I am hopeful all will be will. She thinks they are so cute. Gosh what an experience all of them lived 4 and are eat and flying ready to be released
customer_reviews.author: felicia m lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Defective! No butterflies! Sad pre-k twins
customer_reviews.text: My twins were so excited, but despite following the directions, the larvae never became caterpillars, let alone Chrysalides... and you get the picture. At the time of my purchase, I was very busy transitioning to working from home, schooling my kids. Unfortunately, I missed the window for exchange. My friend used this company before and I’ve used their ladybugs, so it was probably just a bad one- off, but I have to give it one star for the monetary loss and disappointment
customer_reviews.author: JDo

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea of this -- can't purchase if you live somewhere that's hot!
customer_reviews.text: My kids are super stoked for this but unfortunately, all 5 caterpillars died. I called customer service and they informed me that the caterpillars can't live if the temperature (during shipping) is above 85 degrees. I live in Arizona so it's pretty much never below that temperature. Super bummed and now I have the death of 5 caterpillars on my conscience! :( If you live somewhere that's cooler in temperature, I would for sure buy this! Hopefully I can use the voucher to get new caterpillars if/when it cools down!
customer_reviews.author: The Naps

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly kit was fun for grandson
customer_reviews.text: Was delivered quickly and immediately the eggs became larvae and started moving. After a few days they became caterpillars and then after another week the caterpillars started turning into butterflies. It was a great gift for my 11 year old grandson, to see it all happening and the butterflies emerging and finally being able to fly. I had the kit delivered to an Amazon Locker so the box would be safe in a locker instead of on my porch where it might get overheated or damaged. The kit must be kept between 55 and 85 degrees F and fortunately the week that I ordered the kit and they were shipped, the temperature was 85 or below.
customer_reviews.author: John EE Baker

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little project for my 6 year old and I. It was so fun watching the caterpillars grow before going into their cocoons. Also, I was kind of nervous because I thought they had all died, but they do not and we had 3 out of the 5 turn into beautiful butterflies! My 6 year old was loving it waking up everyday to see what was different or what might have changed. I would definitely purchase again from this company. They send you with all the directions you need and also included in the net is the butterfly feeder, and a few other things.
customer_reviews.author: kacey masters

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is amazing! Everything you need. Caterpillars arrive in a closed cup. You do nothing to it until they hit a certain stage (picture guide included) and transfer them to mesh habitat and wait for them to come out of their cocoons. Kit comes with their water and once they’re butterflies, you just feed them cut up fruit. You can release the butterflies when the weather is about 55 degrees. This kit also includes an activity book for the kids to track the caterpillars progress. It’s really cute!! Educational, fun and easy!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great Butterfly Kit
customer_reviews.text: Super fun butterfly growing kit. I ordered two, they both arrived perfectly, baby caterpillars are happy and healthy. Kit included everything as listed, kid friendly instructions, habitat items, and butterfly observation dairy. Looking forward to seeing these little things grow! Highly recommended :)
customer_reviews.author: Annie J

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order in hot summer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter, the caterpillars were dead upon delivery. I ordered this twice, both times she received dead caterpillars. I looked the company up and they don’t recommend these being shipped during hot summer. Amazon should post this information, save some money.
customer_reviews.author: NANA

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything was supplied to include easy to read directions. You don't have to search for things. The directions were really explanatory and matter of fact. No guessing or confusion. Step by step process. This was a great project to do at home. Would also be a great project for the classroom. Out of 10 catapilars all turned into chrysalis but only 8 hatched. Which was great because the instructions low ball it by saying 3 to 5. My child has really enjoyed watching this process. Also developed a new profound respect for butterflies. definitely would buy again. Could be used for a science project too. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte I.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we expected!
customer_reviews.text: Success! To be honest, I hoped for at least 3/5 butterflies. We ordered this kit when the weather in AZ was getting warm, so we worried about packaging. To our excitement, 2 of the caterpillars grew, and within days they were evolving. A third caterpillar was behind the curve, but also grew large enough to start his transformation. The other 2 weren't so fortunate. The kit was easy and clean to work with. I recommended this kit to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Stew

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: Our kit arrived quickly and all of our Caterpillar's are alive. They have already started shedding their exoskeletons and have some webbing in their cup. The food is a little weird and not opening the cup just keeping time in there is strange. I would prefer to find a stick and some leaves putting them in the cage even with the strange brown paste. The booklet that comes with the kit is fantastic. I'd like to opportunity to purchase different kinds of caterpillars too.
customer_reviews.author: Emily D.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wait to get again
customer_reviews.text: I was a little sad because when they arrived the box and content were very warm, only one caterpillar made it and is in chrysalis phase. I know it has to do with the time of year I ordered it and a slight delay in delivery. Maybe add an ice pack to delivery next time to warmer climates or during warmer months. Still very happy and will order more caterpillars in the fall.
customer_reviews.author: Jenea

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the idea of this, could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 3 for my preschool classroom. My students were really excited to see caterpillars do what we read about in The Very Hungry Caterpillar. The package said it would take a few days for them to wake up and move around, but they never really moved a lot. Our 5 caterpillars quickly made a mess in their cup to the point where we couldn't quite see the caterpillars. It took 4 days to make their chrysalis.
customer_reviews.author: k. smith

customer_reviews.title: only got one cup
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered this kit because it has two cups of caterpillars. When I received the package, there was only one cup (even though the packing slip clearly states 2 cups of live caterpillars). I am a teacher and ordered this to begin a unit on Monday, and instead I have to return the kit. Sadly, I don't know if the caterpillars can survive going in a truck to be returned. I wish there was an option to just send me another cup, since that is what I paid for. But unfortunately that is not an option, as I have to send back the entire kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: My kids are enjoying it...
customer_reviews.text: I love getting my kids projects that help them learn and this is one that all of us can get involved in. The kit includes the caterpillars, so you do have to open and use right away. We actually received 6 caterpillars in our kit so felt like we got a little bonus. It's amazing how fast they grow. The customer service is great as well. They were headed to the lid to make their chrysalises and part of the felt they attach to tore off. I contacted customer service by email and they replied same day letting us know what to do. We can't wait for them to become butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: All 10 dead
customer_reviews.text: They arrived at my door froze to death. That’s no way for an animal to die. I’m going to try to purchase again in a later season and see if that makes any difference. But this is really disappointing. My child was really excited only for us to see many frozen to the side and bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Cute gift! All 10 caterpillars emerged as butterflies!
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, our caterpillars had it rough. I have two crazy toddlers who wanted to play with the container so it took a few spills off the counter. I also found my Siamese cat trying to "play" with the butterflies after they emerged probably 2-3x so that was fun... Oh, and my cleaner didn't realize they were butterfly cocoons so she tossed them onto the floor to clean the counters. Despite all of that chaos ALL 10 BUTTERFLIES SURVIVED AND THRIVED!!!! Props to this company for providing specific instructions and high-quality caterpillars. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Kids loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my kids so we can learn about butterflies. The kids enjoyed looking at the caterpillars and the cocoons, and finally the butterflies. My 2-year-old was especially excited to check on the net each morning to check for butterflies. I placed a magnifying glass next to it so the kids could get a better look. We had 8 caterpillars total and all but 1 turned into butterflies. We had a lot of fun releasing the butterflies as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Long Shot

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing! 4 of 5 butterflies made it and 3 are guaranteed. The caterpillars do look dead when first opening the box, but all 5 were moving in a few hours. It took about three weeks from ordering to release and even as an adult the transformation is fascinating. Not much work at all; definitely enjoyable for everyone. We'll buy more caterpillars for another round in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great for the family !
customer_reviews.text: Omg ! I loved this kit !! I originally bought for my kids so they can see the cycle of life. I read the reviews and alot of people said their butterflies died but all of mine lived. Even the one that fell off the lid while in her chrysalides. I just laid it on a napkin in the butterfly house until she hatched. I loved letting them fly and flutter around on my hand . I released them at the very possible end. They were starting to mate so I knew it was time to set then free ! I added a timeline of the pictures. I hope this helps your decision to buy .
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.

customer_reviews.title: My 4 year old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: So fun. 4 year old loves it. Waiting for butterflies. One Caterpillar was trying to knock down the others. He succeeded with one. We superglue it back as we looked it up, separated them and the troublemaker just cacooned himself. We will transfer him with his buddies today.
customer_reviews.author: Robin B. Lydon

customer_reviews.title: Great to teach kids about a butterfly life cycle
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased one of these the last two years because my son loves this! He loves watching the caterpillars grow and change and become butterflies. It is a good way to teach and show them the life cycle in real time. Plus they get to see the butterflies up close before they let them go. We have only had one ever not make it to the butterfly stage. The kit is easy to use, has easy to understand directions and will keep your little one interested the whole way through. Such a great educational purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Dead Caterpillers
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this as a Christmas gift. The caterpillars were dead. I emailed customer service and they advised waiting until spring to replace. I sent them proof of purchase - amazon receipt. I have sent it three times and now they tell me (it is April) that I need a different tracking number. What tracking number I do not know, My kids just want to see these larvae turn into winged creatures and now they cannot! I would give negative stars if I could. I have no idea how to actually get living larvae outside of reordering the entire product which I will not do. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Watching the butterflies grow from little caterpillars into full grown adults was so much fun! All of mine arrived alive and developed normally. I wish we could have kept them longer! My daughter grew really attached to them. I’m glad I got a kit, because this will definitely be doing this again next year! Note: My butterflies liked halved grapes more than the sugar water, and pretty much ignored the fresh cut flowers I put in the mesh cage.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I never review things- check, but there were some mixed reviews on this and I thought I should share my experience. Bought this to keep learning fun for my 4 year old now that school is out. So worth it. Every single caterpillar lived. I definitely wasn't sure at first, but now, 3 days later I can see the tremendous growth. I honestly can't stop watching them wiggle around. They haven't turned into butterfly's just yet, but like I said it's only a few days. Worth buying! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the most unique and fun gifts to give to our children. It was a learning experience for both us and for the kids. We loved watching them grow over the weeks. Once they turned into beautiful butterflies we released them. The children got so much out of this gift I would recommend it for any family. Just a note out of five you may only get three butterflies. This was the case for us. Still a great experience for the family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Cycle of Life for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: What a lovely way to introduce curious little minds to the profound miracle of life on earth! True natural magic proceeds under the watchful eyes of wonder-stricken kids, much to their delight and edification! We had a survival rate of 5 for 5! This delightful and well thought out product provided several weeks of wonder and excitement for the little ones...and the big guys, too! We're going to do this again soon!
customer_reviews.author: William Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great set... be weary of James Bond caterpillar killing you in your sleep.
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason I give this 4 stars and not 5 is because our kit only came with 4 caterpillars instead of 5. The Insect Lore folks gave us some hogwash about caterpillars "getting lost in transportation". If the caterpillar managed to get out of it's sealed cup, boxed inside a thick cardboard boxed, house in ANOTHER cardboard box... we need to sign up that Lepidoptera for a starring role in the next James Bond movie.
customer_reviews.author: Wes/Anna Geminn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fun and educational kit! Can get caterpillar refills for even more fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my niece and she flipped out! It comes with five caterpillars, their food and habitat. All the kids ran to check on it in the morning and after school. It was really cool to see the changes - for kids and adults!! Everything you need to grow your butterflies. You can also get refill kits which I did for my other niece because she was so jealous of her sister's kit. Awesome fun with some science thrown in there. The best fun and educational kit I've found so far! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: WE my wife and I bought this for the grandchildren in the spring and they LOVED it (all 11) . Sent 5 different kits to the various families and each day the families posted their stages on the family tread. WE and the grandkids had a blast and they learned SOOOOOOOO much about butterflies lifecycle! And after the race to hatch their we 5 ceremonies to release the butterflies. By the way all kits had 100% 5 butterflies were release from all 5 kits. some had a week or so delay LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: John R. Panseri

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Fun Kids 3-10 Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the most unique and fun gifts your child and you can truly enjoy together. This Butterfly Garden is amazing and lots of fun, and great experience for learning. Its a little pricy but you will not go wrong getting it for the children in your life. FYI - This gift does take some adult supervision to make sure it works. My wife did a great job with our little ones and all the butterfly hatched properly and moved on happily in their lives.
customer_reviews.author: Health Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: 5 live butterflies!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Massachusetts. We ordered this in August and had a great experience. I was afraid the caterpillars might not survive shipping in the heat but we had no issues. My son loves watching the caterpillars and then the cocoons to eagerly await the butterflies. We missed them coming out of the cocoon, but we did get 5 beautiful butterflies. We set them free the next day. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Unpeachy

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun experience!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter for her 4th birthday. All of her caterpillars turned into butterflies! We fed them blueberries and sugar water for a couple days and we just let them go outside. My daughter LOVED this and it was so fun seeing how proud she was! I will be ordering more for her! The process was uhmmmm, gross lol it’s not quite like what you see in cartoons they drip blood when they come out of their cocoons and they shed their layers multiple times so it’s quite stringy and goopy. Gotta love nature! But hands down is the best “educational” gift you could give.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, caterpillars being alive is hit or miss.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great product and activity for little kids. Our 3 year old was very excited. Sadly, only 1 of the five caterpillars was alive when delivered. It was about 75 degrees when delivered and the box didn’t stay outside for more than a minute when received. I can only assume it sat in a warehouse for awhile. So that’s why we gave it 3 stars. The kit is complete so if the 1 caterpillar survives, we will have at least 1 butterfly.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Fun to raise butterflies.
customer_reviews.text: All of our butterflies survived! This was our first time raising butterflies. Fun and easy to do. Two chrysalises fell to the bottom of the caterpillar cup. We were worried those two might not make it. They were fine! Followed the directions and moved them carefully into the net with the others. All developed and flew away after watching them in the net for a few days. The included booklet is best for younger children, but the whole family enjoyed watching the caterpillars change into butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Silski

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!! So cool for any age!
customer_reviews.text: Such a cool thing! When ours arrived the caterpillars were already half grown so it only took 3 days for them to make the chrysalis and then they emerged in the middle of the night of 6th day (today), we gave them fresh banana slices and we are going to set them free tomorrow evening! All 5 caterpillars made chrysalis's and all 5 emerged healthy! So cool my kids loved this so much and I did too! Well worth the 30 bucks and also now to do it all over all you need is the cup of caterpillars!
customer_reviews.author: Ff5isus

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We loved doing this project. We had 9/10 butterflies fully cycle and release day was a blast. The collapsible cage was simple to use and a snap to hang (during) and store (after) use. I would recommend putting down a paper towel prior to the butterflies hatching from their cocoons to save you a little bit on clean up. Otherwise, I had no problem wiping and washing it down prior to storing it. We can't wait to do this again!
customer_reviews.author: A. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and exciting to watch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a fun activity to do with my kids during the pandemic lock-down. We got 10 caterpillars (and I love that they send the caterpillars with the kit instead of a voucher you have to send in for them!) that we got to watch grow. One chrysalis died (it happens) and one caterpillar is a day or so away from going into his but we got to see 8 beautiful butterflies emerge over the last 48 hours! We have absolutely LOVED watching the process unfold and even got to see a butterfly emerge from start to finish😊
customer_reviews.author: Marien Chabot

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Educational for the Whole Family!
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to set up. You literally do nothing but watch the caterpillars grow as they ear from the food that’s within the jar they come in. Once they hang from the lid you move the lid into the mesh netting until the butterflies come out. It’s amazing! When the butterflies came out we waited a few days and set them free. They hung around for a few minutes and even landed on my daughter’s fingers. So much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: great product -- exactly what it says
customer_reviews.text: cute package of caterpillars, their food, and a cage for them to hatch into when they leave their chrysales. performed just as described. like the very hungry caterpillar, they ate for a week, formed chrysales, and popped out a week later over a period of ~36 hours. the kids let them go the second day. then we filled the cage with mourning cloak chrysales, of which we had dozens, and did it all over again
customer_reviews.author: pb

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a youngster.
customer_reviews.text: All five of my larvae hatched and were released. I enjoyed watching the process and then gave my cage to a young girl who is using it to rear her own butterflies. 3 of the chrysalis were on the bottom of the cage, so I attached them to a stick and they hatched from there. I would suggest instructions for doing this would be helpful to a purchaser. I bought one for my grandson and he enjoyed watching the life cycle of the painted ladies.
customer_reviews.author: JWT

customer_reviews.title: Great learning experience, and fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old and I LOVED this. Such a great experience. All 5 larva hatched. Once hatched we fed the butterflies fruit, and sugar water, we let them go in our yard and I’m very excited to do this again. I researched and looked into many kits and this one seemed the best, and for the best value. Loved the book included as well to add drawings, any 4 year old isn’t able to do that yet but hopefully next time we order butterflies he will be. Now we have all the pieces we need just need to order more larva.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan stubbs

customer_reviews.title: Good activity for kids
customer_reviews.text: This was a great activity to do with my children. Once the butterflies came out of their cocoon they started flying around in the mesh so sporadic that they kept crashing into each other. By the noon we decided we could not keep them the 3-5 days the instruction indicate before releasing. That first day we had to release them and one had already broke off 2 of its legs and another’s wings were broken.
customer_reviews.author: Gotn2u2

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for granddaughter!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 yr old granddaughter loved this Butterfly Garden! She got to watch the caterpillars make their cocoon and then watch them hatch into butterflies! When ready to release, she let them "light" on her arm until they were ready to fly away! It was a great experience for her! I would definitely recommend this Butterfly Garden as a good purchase! The set also comes with information on how to purchase more caterpillars by mail too so the experience can be repeated!
customer_reviews.author: Tj69

customer_reviews.title: Fun and memorable experience for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: We had an excellent experience! All of our six caterpillars started moving within 24 hours and all six formed a chrysalis. Five survived to emerge as butterflies. One of them my children and I got to witness firsthand. Such a fun experience and well worth the price of the kit. It has everything you need and clear directions. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Vog

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies that will not thrive ... maybe not even survive release
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased from this company for the past few years. This year, only 4 got to the cocoon stage - one caterpillar didn't make it. Now that they've hatched, we've got one with a terribly misshapen wing that cannot fly and one that's a butterfly but apparently didn't complete metamorphosis and has the body of a butterfly and the face/head of a caterpillar. I feel so bad for these poor butterflies that will likely not survive release. Poor quality. The first year we bought them, all 5 thrived. The next year, we got three live and healthy butterflies out of three. This year ... we're having some sad conversations with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Second Guess Buying This! It's a Fantastic Experience!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this when she was about 10 -12 years old and again when she was 17 years old. We enjoyed the first experience, but were even more intrigued the second time around watching them grow and hatch. She took charge of the feeding and releasing so it helped that she was older. It was sad when a couple did not make it, so realize this may happen. I highly recommend this experience and read the directions carefully to provide the butterflies the best chance of living. It's not a difficult or time consuming process.
customer_reviews.author: bridget scileppi

customer_reviews.title: Iffy at best
customer_reviews.text: I returned it twice (yes I wanted it that much) and both times they came already hatched and died within a day no matter what I did. Should mention that send it to grandkids as gift shipped from amazon and it worked very well for them and they were able to release 10 butterflies to the nature. It just didn’t work for me. The grandkids got eggs and watched them hatch and I got actual worms (maybe hatched while shipping ?). That seems to be the only difference we could find on why they didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Varg

customer_reviews.title: Cute but no live caterpillars.
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about this as it was a gift for a friend's kiddos. It was very cute with all the items accounted for and looked to be great quality. I was disappointed though to find that all of the caterpillars were dead. The instructions said they may be "quiet" and would perk up after a few days so we thought maybe they were alive and I gave the gift. Nope, definitely still dead after a few weeks. So sad!!! Maybe it was the heat while shipping? Anyway, it was a total bust and I can't return because I gave it as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: No caterpillars
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and it came without my 2 cups of caterpillars. The box said open immediately. The directions told me how to do everything with them. But the caterpillars were missing. I emailed Insect Lore with no response. $43 for a mesh circle.....
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: The caterpillars grew on schedule. They made their cocoons on the lid. They emerged. They flew away. The instructions guaranteed 3 of 5 caterpillars would end up as butterflies. I started with 10 caterpillars. All 10 made cocoons. 9 became butterflies (although I'm giving the last one some more time). 8 flew away (the 9th one is just chilling out on the deck). Overall success. The three year old loved it.
customer_reviews.author: pt314159

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this farm to help us pass the time during the coronavirus. We bought two cups of caterpillars with this farm. They all turned into chrysalis. ( btw they do not all change at the same time...Once the LAST caterpillar changes...THEN count the 3 full days to remove the top of the lid and put them into the farm. ) We fed out butterflies strawberries and they are really loving that more then the sugar water. We really enjoyed it and would highly highly recommend! We even shared with her class on seesaw. :)
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: All five survived
customer_reviews.text: All five survived! Only three attached to the lid and I almost threw away the other two but they looked to be progressing the same as the hanging ones so I kept them. Even after the hanging three came out of their cocoons I still thought the other two were dead and almost threw them away again. Came back later the same day and they all had emerged. Do not worry if they all do not attach to the lid- they may still make it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lydon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful butterflies.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a science experiment for the kids to learn about the different stages of how a larva turns into a butterfly. The kit itself was simple and easy to set up the only issue is that only 2 butterflies hatched. Guess that is nature which they learned as well that not everything hatches out of a cocoon. They did enjoy letting them free and butterflies were beautiful to look at. The cage did rip as we used it for other cocoons in hopes we would watch that process as well but overall it did its job except for the butterflies that didn't hatch.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique Zadovsky

customer_reviews.title: Love this, even as an adult :)
customer_reviews.text: Just read and follow instructions and everything goes as planned. My daughter received this as a gift when she was 7 and it was fun for both of us. She's a teenager now and I bought this both of us, but maybe more for me. LOL it's fun watching the different stages from caterpillar to butterfly and releasing the butterflies. Just make sure you time the butterfly delivery and release with weather reports. Look for temperatures between 55 degrees and 80 degrees Fahrenheit for delivery and release.
customer_reviews.author: cjrudi

customer_reviews.title: Fun but with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: My 17 yr old daughter wanted this and enjoyed watching the butterflies come to life. Not all of the butterflies hatched from cocoons and it was very difficult to transfer the cocoons from jar into the net with them on the lid. That is a bad design. We will not follow the directions as closely next time. Maybe put tree branches in the net and let them cocoon inside net instead of jars.
customer_reviews.author: April P.

product_meta.title: Insect Lore Butterfly Garden: Original Habitat and Live Cup of Caterpillars with STEM Butterfly Journal – Life Science & STEM Education – Butterfly Kit
product_meta.description: Style:Butterfly Garden with STEM JournalLearn all about the butterfly life cycle with Insect Lore's best-loved butterfly kit. See Tiny Caterpillars Grow, Grow, Grow into Butterflies!A family and educator favorite for over 50 years, the Butterfly Garden with live caterpillars provides fun learning and will engage the whole family. It comes with 5 baby caterpillars and everything you need to get them growing! The entire project takes about 3 weeks. Watch the transformation from caterpillars to chrysalides, to beautiful Painted Lady butterflies - then let your butterflies go to help pollinate our world.Butterfly feeder color may vary.Please check the weather in your area. Daytime temperatures must be 55 degrees Fahrenheit or above when you release your butterflies.We cannot ship live insects to Mexico, Canada, Hawaii, or Puerto Rico.Ages 4+
feature_bullets: 5 LIVE baby caterpillars and nutritious food
Pop-up, reusable 12 inch tall mesh habitat
Two Deluxe Chrysalis Station Logs and a Flower-shaped Butterfly Feeder
STEM Butterfly Journal with learning activities

Important NOTE! Please postpone your live order if daytime temperatures in your area are below 55 degrees or above 85 degrees Fahrenheit Your caterpillars may not survive their journey to you in extreme heat or cold We cannot ship live insects to Hawaii Mexico Canada or Puerto Rico

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars7,144 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
